docs.lead_paragraph: A study finds that pharmaceutical companies have cut drug prices in response to political pressure.

headline.main: Even Talking About Reducing Drug Prices Can Reduce Drug Prices
headline.print_headline: Even Talking About Drug Prices Can Slow Their Rise

docs.abstract: The Upshot; research shows that political talk about reining in drug prices can itself help reduce cost, even if legislation does not emerge; pharmaceutical stocks have declined since Democratic politicians, including presidential hopefuls and Pres Obama, have turned their attention to issue, trend that could encourage firms to lower prices.
docs.snippet: A study finds that pharmaceutical companies have cut drug prices in response to political pressure.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton Leave Sparring Behind at a King Day Event

docs.abstract: Hours after engaging in their most contentious debate to date, Hillary Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders reconvened in a less charged setting to honor the memory of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.
docs.snippet: Hours after engaging in their most contentious debate to date, Hillary Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders reconvened in a less charged setting to honor the memory of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

docs.lead_paragraph: Facing fresh campaign anxieties, Hillary Clinton is attaching herself to President Barack Obama, hoping to overcome liberal enthusiasm for Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders with a full-throated embrace of her one-time rival and boss.

docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic White House candidate Bernie Sanders went on the offensive against front-runner Hillary Clinton on Sunday in the most contentious of their four presidential debates, accusing her of cozying up to Wall Street and misrepresenting his stance on healthcare and guns.

docs.lead_paragraph: Should progressives re-litigate Obamacare? There are many reasons to think that it just wouldn’t work.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column argues progressive politicians should not seek to re-litigate Affordable Care Act in post-Obama era but should build on program's successes to make incremental improvements in health coverage; acknowledges failings of Obamacare, but points to limits of single-payer model under current American system and greater difficulty of beginning again from scratch; contends progressives should make other pressing priorities their focus.
docs.snippet: Should progressives re-litigate Obamacare? There are many reasons to think that it just wouldn’t work.

headline.main: Transcript of the Democratic Presidential Debate

docs.snippet: Following is a transcript of the Democratic debate, as transcribed by the Federal News Service.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton targeted Bernie Sanders’s electoral appeal with some of her strongest language yet in a debate on Sunday night, trying to undercut his image as an anti-political truth teller.

headline.main: In Democratic Debate, Hillary Clinton Challenges Bernie Sanders on Policy Shifts
headline.print_headline: Clinton Seizes on Policy Shifts in 4th Debate

docs.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton, in fourth Democratic presidential debate, attacks Bernie Sanders over his policy shifts on health care and gun control and seeks to portray him as fringe candidate at odds with Pres Obama's accomplishments; Sanders appears exasperated at times as Clinton attempts to undermine his consistency on policy issues, one of his strong suits with voters.
docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton targeted Bernie Sanders’s electoral appeal with some of her strongest language yet in a debate on Sunday night, trying to undercut his image as an anti-political truth teller.
